page.title: 15THE WOODHOUSE NEWS
page.content: The Woodhouse News is a free{ {community newspaper}delivered to every household on the large Woodhouse Close {council estate.}The paper is run by an editorial committee from the{Social {Services Advice Centre}which occupies two adjoining semi-detached houses on the estate. The idea for the paper came from the local vicar and a number of people on the estate who felt that the issues facing them were not well enough understood. The{aim of the paper}was to inform everyone of these issues and to publicise any events or functions on the estate, as well as the social services available from the Advice Centre. Since 1974 then paper has been delivered to{2000 homes every four to {six weeks.}The local council provided funds but has now withdrawn them and finance comes from advertising, &c.
